title: Crescent Dogs Recipe
description: These crescent roll hot dogs feature a yummy American cheese filling wrapped in flaky, buttery dough for an tasty, updated piggies in a blanket snack.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Everyday Cooking Crescent Dogs 4.5 (218) 163 Reviews 62 Photos These crescent roll hot dogs are similar to piggies in a blanket but with a yummy surprise: melted cheese in each frank. Submitted by Pillsbury Updated on November 16, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 62 62 62 62 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 15 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 crescent dogs Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 8 hot dogs 4 slices American cheese, each cut into 6 strips 1 (8 ounce) can Pillsbury® refrigerated crescent dinner rolls Directions Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Slit hot dogs to within 1/2 inch of ends; insert 3 cheese strips into each slit. Separate crescent dough into triangles. Wrap each hot dog with a dough triangle, then place cheese-side up on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 12 to 15 minutes. I Made It Print 417 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Crescent Dogs 01 of 62 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 62 Photo by  Marianne Davy 02/05/2025 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite I have made these & they're delicious. Almost addictive! I'm now trying different types of cheeses. Perfect recipe. I do turn the crescent half way through & sometimes have to cook them a little longer. 03 of 62 Photo by  Shannon Wong 07/31/2021 04 of 62 Photo by  LStat 05/23/2021 05 of 62 Photo by  Tiffany 01/17/2021 Super easy recipe! I used thick shredded cheddar cheese. Served with ketchup and mustard. 06 of 62 Photo by  Tiffany 01/17/2021 Super easy recipe! I used thick shredded cheddar cheese. name: Pillsbury
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).;Slit hot dogs to within 1/2 inch of ends; insert 3 cheese strips into each slit.;Separate crescent dough into triangles. Wrap each hot dog with a dough triangle, then place cheese-side up on an ungreased cookie sheet.;Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 12 to 15 minutes.
